issues.issue_type: Use of frozen Russian assets for Ukraine loan
issues.details: EU plans to provide â‚¬140bn interestâ€‘free loan to Ukraine using frozen Russian assets, but Belgium opposes due to legal liability and risk of retaliation.

issues.issue_type: EUâ€™s stance on US peace plan
issues.details: Ursula criticized the US draft peace plan as too favorable to Russia and said EU is working to modify it.

responses.clarification: EU will continue to support Ukraine step by step and will not allow any decision that excludes Europe or Ukraine.
EU will seek to use frozen Russian assets for a loan to Ukraine, but negotiations with Belgium are ongoing.

evaluations.opinion: Neutral reporting on EUâ€™s position and Belgiumâ€™s opposition.

confirmed_facts: Ursula von der Leyen stated EU will continue supporting Ukraine and pressuring Russia.
EU plans a â‚¬140bn interestâ€‘free loan to Ukraine using frozen Russian assets.
Belgium opposes the loan due to legal liability concerns.

timeline.event: Ursula von der Leyen speaks in Strasbourg, pledges continued EU support for Ukraine and pressure on Russia.
Upcoming EU summit where EU leaders aim to finalize the use of frozen Russian assets for Ukraine loan.
